newsitem.title: USA: McAfee sees competition cutting prices, margins.
newsitem.headline: McAfee sees competition cutting prices, margins.

text.p: McAfee Associates Inc said the market for its products is "intensely competitive" and increasing competition, which it expects to further encounter, could reduce its average selling prices and profit margins.
The Santa Clara, Calif.,-based software company made the disclosure in a quarterly financial report to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

"Competitive pressures could result not only in sustained price reductions but also in a decline in sales volume, it said, adding that would materially adversely affect its business, financial condition and results of operation," it said.
In addition, it said competitive pressures will make it difficult for it to maintain its growth rate.
The company said as the network management market develops, it may face increased competition from larger companies such as Microsoft Corp, Novell Inc and Hewlett-Packard Co.
McAfee writes software that detects viruses and prevents unauthorized access to information in computer networks and supplies software that makes it easier to manage complex computer networks.
McAfee was down 2-7/8 to 59-1/2 in afternoon trading.
